author: Razi Taraji

sections.heading: Introduction
sections.content: Come to The Niagara Falls Public Library LaSalle Branch and learn about how animals in Western NY adapt and respond to the changing environment and cooler temperatures.

image.caption: Alligators adapt to frozen zoo enclosure

sections.heading: What is this talk about?
sections.content: Which animals hibernate? What happens to reptiles, amphibians, and insects? How do birds find food?

sections.heading: Who is speaking?
sections.content: This talk will be given by a naturalist from Niagara Falls State Park and is sponsored by The Niagara Falls Public Library. Free parking in the back of the library.

title: Nature in Winter
The Winter Show at The Wurlitzer
author: Jacob Shi
summary: 908 Niagara Falls Boulevard, North Tonawanda, NY 14120, United States

sections.heading: Introduction
sections.content: Get ready for a slithery and scaly extravaganza at the The Winter Show at The Wurlitzer brought to you by WNY Reptiles!

image.caption: WNY reptiles presents Winter at the Wurlitzer

sections.heading: What is this talk about?
sections.content: Join us for a day filled with fascinating reptiles, educational exhibits, and interactive experiences. Whether you’re a seasoned reptile enthusiast, oddities collector, plant aficionado, or just curious about these amazing creatures, this event is perfect for all ages.

sections.heading: What will I learn?
sections.content: Come meet a variety of reptiles up close, learn about their habitats, and even have the chance to handle some of them! Check out our carnivorous plant displays, maybe even take one home! Do you like the unusual? Visit our oddities vendors for preserved specimens, taxidermy, mounts and more! Don’t miss out on this unique opportunity to appreciate the beauty and diversity of reptiles while exploring the historic Wurlitzer building.

sections.heading: Mark your calendars
sections.content: Mark your calendars and join us for a day of fun and learning at the The Winter Show at The Wurlitzer!

sections.heading: Introduction
sections.content: Not a PA Day for your school? No problem! An event recording will be emailed to all registrants. The recording will be accessible until 5 PM on Friday, November 26.

sections.heading: What is this talk about?
sections.content: Bring world-class nature education into your living room with a Zoo-Zoom experience! Join other alumni kids from around the world to learn about an awesome assortment of cool creatures with an Animal Educator from Little Ray’s Nature Centre.

sections.heading: What will I learn?
sections.content: This hour-long session features a 45-minute presentation showcasing 8-10 rescued reptiles and mammals, followed by a 15-minute interactive Q&A where kids can learn even more about their favourite animals.

sections.heading: Please note
sections.content: Please note, this Zoom Meeting will be recorded and shared with registrants. You may activate or deactivate your camera at your discretion.
